Class LevelTwo

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
com.example.demo.levels.LevelTwo
public class LevelTwo extends LevelParent
LevelTwo represents the second level of the game, featuring a boss battle, power-ups, and a transition to the next level. This class extends LevelParent and defines level-specific logic, including enemy spawning, power-ups, and victory conditions.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelTwo

      public LevelTwo(double screenHeight, double screenWidth, Controller controller)
      Constructs a new LevelTwo instance.
      Parameters:
      screenHeight - the height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - the width of the game screen.
      controller - the game controller managing the level.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units for this level. This adds the player-controlled unit to the game root.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class LevelParent

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over by evaluating the player's or boss's state. If the player is destroyed, the game ends with a loss. If the boss is destroyed, transitions to the next level.
      Specified by:
      checkIfGameOver in class LevelParent

    • checkIfReadyToProceed

      private void checkIfReadyToProceed()
      Checks if all conditions are met to proceed to the next level. If both the boss down sound and explosion animation are finished, transitions to the next level.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units for this level. If there are no existing enemies, the boss is added to the game.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent

    • animateBossEntry

      private void animateBossEntry()
      Animates the boss's entry from off-screen to its final position.

    • spawnPowerUps

      private void spawnPowerUps()
      Spawns power-ups during the level. Spawns either an ActorLevelUp or HeartItem based on probabilities.

    • addPowerUp

      private void addPowerUp(Actor powerUp)
      Adds a power-up to the game root and power-ups list.
      Parameters:
      powerUp - the power-up to be added.

    • NewHeartDisplay

      protected HeartDisplay NewHeartDisplay(javafx.scene.Group root, double xPosition, double yPosition, int heartsToDisplay)
      Creates a new HeartDisplay for this level with a fixed number of hearts.
      Overrides:
      NewHeartDisplay in class LevelParent
      Parameters:
      root - the root group to which the HeartDisplay belongs.
      xPosition - the x-coordinate for the HeartDisplay.
      yPosition - the y-coordinate for the HeartDisplay.
      heartsToDisplay - the number of hearts to display.
      Returns:
      a new HeartDisplay instance.

    • getObjectiveText

      protected String getObjectiveText()
      Provides the objective text for this level.
      Specified by:
      getObjectiveText in class LevelParent
      Returns:
      the objective text for this level.
